label1.title: The Deltoid Muscle: Function
label1.text: <font size = 10>Functions mainly to move the upper arm away from the body at the shoulder </font size = 10>

label2.title: The Deltoid Muscle: Innervation
label2.text: Is stimulated by the axillary nerve

label3.title: The Deltoid Muscle: Location
label3.text: Resides on the side of the upper arm at the shoulder and connects the scapula to the humerus

label4.title: The Digital Flexor Muscles: Function
label4.text: Function together to flex the fingers causing the formation of a fist

label5.title: The Digital Flexor Muscles: Innervation
label5.text: Is stimulated by the median and ulnar nerves

label6.title: The Digital Flexor Muscles: Location
label6.text: Reside on the front of the forearm when the palm is facing forward and connects the arms to the fingers

label7.title: The Triceps Muscle: Function
label7.text: Functions to extend the lower arm at the elbow

label8.title: The Triceps Muscle: Innervation
label8.text: Is stimulated by the radial nerve

label9.title: The Triceps Muscle: Location
label9.text: Resides on the back of the arm and connects the upper arm to a bone of the lower arm
